trial_identification.studytitle: Asymptomatic Increased endometrial thickness in postmenopausal women .risk factors
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Asymptomatic increased endometrial thickness in postmenopausal women: risk factors

conditions.healthcondition: risk factors causing increased endometrial thickness in post menopause

interventions.interventions: This study is evaluating the hypothesis that, there are some factors causing increased the endometrium thickness in some asymptomatic postmenopausal women that carried increased risk of cellular changes. Histopathology will be done for cases with increased thickness.40 minutes consultation at baseline visit .
interventions.comparator: 73 women in each group of asymptomatic post-menopause women will be recruited ,Women will be divided according to endometrial thickness into: Group (A): those having 5 mm endometrial thickness or more . Group (B): those having less than 5 mm endometrial thickness .

primaryOutcome.outcome: The variation in ET measured by trans-vaginal ultrasound
primaryOutcome.timepoint: they will be checked at once at baseline visit.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The variation in ET with respect to presence of myoma by using trans-vaginal ultrasound .
The variation in ET with respect to uterine volume by using trans-vaginal ultrasound .

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Postmenopausal women. No vaginal bleeding. Intact uterus.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Women with gynecological symptoms e.g. vaginal bleeding, bloody discharge Women underwent gynecological operation e.g. hysterectomy or recent D&C. Women with ovarian or endometrium or cervical cancer. Patients under hormonal therapy

trial_design.statisticalmethods: (73 in each arm, asymptomatic post-menopause women will be recruited according to G.Power 3.0.10 software sample size calculator assuming that Effect size d =0.5, a err prob= 0.05, Power (1-Beta err prob) =0.85, Allocation ratio N2/N1 =1

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: AlAzhar unversity hospital for girls 4 Dawood Barakat street ,Nasr city Cairo Egypt

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Alzhraa university hospital Elmostashfa elyuonany street,Abassia,cairo postcode 11651

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Study hypothesis: This study suggests that there are some factors causing increased the endometrium thickness in some asymptomatic postmenopausal women that carried increased risk of cellular changes.characterization of those patient could help to pick up risky patients for endometrial cancer.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Ethical committee of the Department of gynecology and obstetrics, Faculty of Medicine, AL-Azhar University
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: 4 Dawood Barakat street ,nasr city , Cairo Egypt
